name: Amanda
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
My boyfriend and I came down to this property for a long weekend for his birthday. We were able to bring our dog and it was such a restful time away from the hustle and bustle of every day. The dog thoroughly enjoyed the fenced yard, and because of the time of the year, we were able to to take him down to Folly Beach to play in the water, via direct beach access from the house.
The property was in mint condition, which is great to see, considering they do allow animals on site. Everything was very clean, very good instructions, very easy, and the host was very accommodating.
It was a quick drive to downtown Charleston, which was perfect for us to go during the day and sightsee, but come back to the restfulness and peacefulness of the ocean front property at night. When looking at a map, it does say about a 30 minute drive to downtown, but keep in mind 10 of those minutes is just to get from the house to downtown Folly Beach. From there it's a quick shot to the highway.
We would recommend this property, hands-down, any day. Well worth the cost!

review_text: I was searching for a place near Charleston and ended up coming across The Sandy Dog Beach House. This was the perfect spot for my family, and I was so happy to find a place where I was allowed to bring my pups along with us! Being steps from the beach was a dream come true. We could walk right outside with our son and play in the sand, and the dogs enjoyed stretching their legs in the fenced-in yard. The views from the balconies were so beautiful, especially catching the sunrise over the water! We will definitely stay here again when we make a trip back next year! The hosts were very responsive and kind.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The house has a well-equipped kitchen. Check-in is easy and the bathrooms all has soap shampoo and body wash. There were plenty of fluffy white towels and special black make up towels. They do not provide any beach towels or beach chairs so be sure to bring your own. This is a pet friendly house, and we did not bring any pets but be aware there were places in the yard that previous people did not clean up after their pets. Yuck! There are 2 nice porches on the front of the house but the house in front of this one has really strong flood lights that automatically come on from dusk until dawn and it makes it impossible to sit outside at night without feeling like you are in an interrogation room. they also light up the master bedroom at night and can be annoying.

My family and I had a blast at the Sandy Dog Beach house. The moment we arrived everything was sparkling clean and laid out exactly like the pictures. The beach is only steps away and that proximity was a game changer for us. Jane and Dave as well as Duvet were so responsive when we had any questions.
Our stay in Folly Beach at the Sandy Dog was without a doubt one of the best family vacations we have ever been on. The house is absolutely beautiful and interior is very well designed with the fresh modern look and with updated appliances. The sectional with the chaise lounge was our favorite spot to unwind after a great day at the beach. We will definitely be back and highly recommend this special place!
Thank you, Jane and Dave!

review_text: We prefer to stay in Folly Beach bc it's beautiful and quaint. This house was perfect for our family to relax, play games, walk on the beach, and go back and forth from Charleston, Mt Pleasant and Sullivan's Island. We looked forward to our evenings together by the ocean. The one sunny day, we spent a few hours on the deck drinking coffee and chatting. The other 2 days were rainy but the house was comfy and we didn't mind at all. We didn't rent a golf cart this time so we had to drive to Taco Boy and Berts, but there was no trouble parking bc of the time of year. Stay Duvet made plenty of towels, toilet paper, soaps, etc available. We never needed to replace any paper products or toiletries. We will stay again next time we are in the Charleston area.🌴

review_text: We absolutely loved staying at Tim’s place. In addition to being a charming old home in the heart of Charleston, the Airbnb was fully stocked with snacks, wine, and toiletries. The bed was super comfortable and the pillows were high quality. Tim was great at offering recommendations and he also had a lot of other resources for things to do in Charleston. Whenever we come back we will be staying here again!

name: Larry
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is the cream of the crop! It is perfectly situated so that all the popular spots are in walking distance, yet it’s far enough that you get privacy and no noise at night. Tim was a fantastic host, he reached out to let us know that he was available if we needed something. I ended up breaking something and felt terrible about it, I sent the pictures to Tim but he told me that it was ok and he would take care of it. The house is extremely comfy and cozy, and Tim goes over the top to make your experience one you will never forget. Tim had coffee, wine, snacks, band-aids, Tums, and even an Alexa device to guide you with restaurants, shopping and other touristy things to do. When I come back, I’ll stay here again!

review_text: My daughters and I stayed at Tim’s place for a week (for my daughter’s wedding!) and it was perfect in every way. By far my favorite Airbnb I’ve stayed in. The beds are so incredibly comfy, the kitchen has anything you’d ever need and the sunny bright rooms are so inviting. The dedicated parking space is a huge bonus as we were doing lots of errands for the wedding. My favorite part though, is the outside patio where we sipped morning coffee and afternoon wine and friends stopped by to say hello. We will DEFINITELY be back. Thanks Tim!

review_text: Tim's place is perfect. It's beautiful and clean with so many amenities. He's really thought of everything to make his guests comfortable. Instructions for everything were super clear and he was proactive and responsive in his communication. The location couldn't have been better. It's in a quiet part of the historic district of Charleston and walkable to everything we wanted to do. The farthest we walked was 30 minutes to restaurants and most attractions were at most a 15 minute walk. We were always grateful after a busy day to get back to Tim's quiet, beautiful place. I highly recommend the nearby Queen Street Grocery for breakfast or lunch.

review_text: My husband and I enjoyed a long weekend at Tim's place. It is spotlessly clean, very spacious, and comfortable. The king bed is amazingly comfortable with linens that feel like a spa! The kitchen is extremely well stocked. I cooked 2 dinners - the casserole dish, pots and pans, and knives were great. Tim has provided every convenience for his guests. The apartment is in a great location - easily walkable to all the sights in Charleston. The apt is very quiet and private but in a super fun neighborhood with a great vibe - lots of neighbors out walking their dogs, good community feel, and a little cafe about a block away. A great weekend in Charleston - a beautiful city for sure!

The house is in the historic residential area, and thus was very quiet in the evening. The location provided an easy walk to all the major restaurants, shopping, and numerous historic sites. The Battery and Ashley River was also in proximity.
We would highly recommend Tim’s apartment and would stay there again if given the opportunity.

It's a cool, historic building that shows its age in a good way. Everything was clean and there was plenty of space. Tim provided everything we needed, gave us enough privacy to make the place feel like ours, and even dropped off coffee filters 5 minutes after messaging him about them.
I would highly recommend Tim's place for the location if you want a calm and quiet base to explore and aren't expecting a thriving bar scene a block away. The house and the host make it a great combo.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Perfect stay in the downtown area. The house was exactly as described, full of historic character. All the amenities were provided, clean, new, etc. There's even cookware, an instant-pot if you felt like cooking, although, with the awesome restaurant scene in Charleston, who would?! Everything functioned as it should, the AC was nice and cold, fans, lights, wi-fi all worked flawlessly. The windows are a little thin, so you do hear outside noise, which isn't an issue for me, but my wife hears everything. She brought a white noise machine (she brings it everywhere we go) and had no problems. The parking spot is 1 ft from the door, seriously. I was literally handing suitcases from the trunk, to my wife, standing at the door. It couldn't be any easier, and with most places having street or valet, this was a HUGE benefit. A wonderful stay and certainly wouldn't hesitate to return.

review_text: Tim’s place was everything we needed and everything we didn’t know we needed! I would give 10 stars if I could. Tim has truly thought of everything. The location cannot be beat - you don’t have to use a car your whole trip, walking distance to everything we wanted to see! Tim’s place was impeccably clean. The place also has everything you could ever need - Tim includes travel sizes of every toiletry you need (including makeup wipes and mouthwash!), the kitchen is fully stocked, including with snack bars, coffee pods, individual creamers, and all cookware and utensils - and even 2 bottles of wine! The location is pretty quiet, but Tim still included a sound machine for the occasional passerby. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and sheets were so soft. Tim was also so accommodating with early checkin and late checkout, and so friendly and willing to help when needed. 10/10 would come here again.

I will be looking to make Tim's home "my home away from home" for future visits and have already shared information about this fabulous Air B&B with others.

review_text: 163 Queen St. is a great location in walking distance of almost everything you would want to see and do in downtown charleston. Our host, tim, has paid a lot of attention to details that mean a lot to a couple. My wife was quite pleased to find a makeup mirror and a sound machine. There were nice umbrellas for a rainy day, and bug spray if needed late in the afternoon and evening. The kitchen was well stocked with everything you would need to cook a fine dinner. The king sized bed was as nice as any I have ever slept on. A sitting area out front was a nice place to have a cocktail and enjoy the passers by. We did not have to get in touch with our host, but Tim made sure that we knew he was available if necessary. My son and his wife who live in downtown Charleston were impressed as well. You will not be disappointed if you choose this location.

name: Rachel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This unit and Tim were both fantastic! A real home away from home in the heart of Charleston. The house is so charming, with tons of historic character. The floors are a little slanted in some places, but I found that it just adds to the character.
My husband and I stayed 5 nights and fell in love with this charming space. There is a gigantic master bedroom with king size bed, closet, and dresser. The second "bedroom" is a sunroom off the back entrance/kitchen with a full wall of windows on two sides and a curtain to close it off (no door). It's at the opposite end of the unit from the other bedroom, so it still feels private. Since there were just 2 of us, we used the second bedroom space for storing our things. The master bed was comfortable, as was the bedding. I didn't test out the second bed, but it looked comfy as well.
The bathroom had plenty of storage and counter space and the provided toiletries were good quality. We had plenty of towels and those were nice too.
The kitchen was amazing and well appointed. There was even an instant pot! The coffee maker is a Keurig and the host provided a good supply of k-cups. There were little coffee mates in the fridge for creamer as well. There is on-demand hot water at the kitchen sink for tea, and a French press for ground coffee. The fridge and freezer were huge and had plenty of storage space for a week's worth of groceries. There were even snacks and wine for us in the welcome basket. Such a great touch!
The living room was very comfortable, with a big couch and comfortable chair and a large TV and coffee table. The TV has a Roku device, so you can sign in to apps you use at home like Netflix or Hulu.
There is a full size washer and dryer in a little nook off the living room, which we were happy to take advantage of to wash our sandy beach towels and bathing suits! Tim even provided laundry pods under the bathroom sink.
The location of this unit is perfect if you want to get out and explore Charleston on foot. Several times each day, the horse drawn carriage tours come down the street. It's a quick walk to King Street, if that's your thing. There is a beautiful little lake just about 2 blocks away, and you're very close to the waterfront for amazing sunset views. Queen Street Grocery is just a block away and is a great spot to pop in for breakfast or lunch to go. The off-street parking was easy to access, and we liked that our car was just outside the door so we could keep an eye on it. The area feels very safe, but I'm always wary of street parking.
The one tip I'd give anyone staying here is that the shower temperature is really tricky to get right. The first day I took a scalding hot shower because I could only get it to be either full blast hot or ice cold. By the second day, we figured out that if you leave both the rain shower head AND the shower wand on (use the knob to find the spot where they both are on as high as they'll go), you can get a good hot-but-not-scalding mix.
Overall this place is a 10/10 and I will DEFINITELY be back. If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Charleston, book this place now!

Although the traffic is rather crazy around Charleston, we found it easy enough to navigate the area and lots of parking ramps in town. Would highly recommend this cute little house.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
The host did an unbelievable renovation on this home. Gorgeous interior, beautiful porch, luxurious features - fantastic bed, pillows, linens, glassware, etc - 5 star hotel worthy. Excellent communication and check in/out process. Very good neighborhood restaurants to explore - xbb and pink cactus. And a gorgeous park, Hampton park, to the north.
The considerations:
- You are 1+ mi from the traditional Charleston visitor sites, check your map closely or bring your walking shoes.
- The block is the last block before the neighborhood ends (into the highway), most homes on this block are not maintained like this one.
- The fenced backyard area pictured, with patio furniture, is where the host lives. They invite you to enter, but you’re basically sitting on their front stoop, so I did not feel comfortable. I thought I was booking a fenced backyard for my pup, but that’s actually their pups yard.
This may all be fine for you, but I wasn’t completely clear when I booked, so honest feedback. I prefer renting from hosts vs property companies, and top-notch dog-friendly places are hard to come by, so would definitely stay again.

name: Nicole
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A lovely house with tons of windows and natural light, beautifully renovated and with surprisingly awesome beds, pillows, sheets, and towels that, while usually an afterthought to me, absolutely made the experience more luxurious. The open floor plan with the freestanding fireplace and beautiful furnishings made the house just really fun to hang out in, and we enjoyed renting a movie through the Roku and watching it on the big screen.
Having two rooms with king sized beds, two full bathrooms and a nice kitchen for cooking meals at the house were a rare combination and made this a really easy, comfortable, low-stress trip for my husband and me, my parents and our two dogs. During the pandemic that’s worth a whole lot. To boot, I had just recovered from omicron and my isolation time threw off the whole trip, and Jessie was very accommodating and fair to find a solution for adjusting our dates a bit.
The house is in an especially convenient location if you have a car and want to visit beaches and other outlying areas, and as long as you like to walk (which is really my favorite thing to do in Charleston.) There are some great restaurants nearby too, and this is a nice quiet neighborhood street. We really enjoyed relaxing on the porches even though we didn’t have nearly the amount of time for it that I would have liked.
The back courtyard is especially great given the pandemic — reservations at places with spaced outdoor seating are hard to come by so we had to default to takeout a couple of times and having a nice place to eat it outside by the beautiful little orange trees and burbling fountain was much appreciated. I’ll also note that there isn’t a full dining table for 4 inside, just 3 seats each at the table and the island, but a full dining table is quite rare at this price point in the historic district anyway, especially in combination with multiple king sized beds. There’s just not space for that in most of these old houses, so having space for 4 outside was great.
Jessie was extremely responsive and helpful and shared some great restaurant recommendations. Overall a delightful experience and we hope to return soon.

review_text:
We were visiting the area as my sister lives in James Island and my husband, my sister-in-law and I stayed at Nan's place over the holiday weekend for my husbands' birthday.
Nan's place was exactly as described and we had a wonderful time! It was so cozy and comfy and we had a lot of time to relax and chill as well.
The weather was up and down and it would be lovely to be here in the Spring/Summer/Fall & take advantage of the outdoor shower and the front porch to just chill and hang out.
We had the three of us there and were never without hot water, the beds were comfy and there were ample linens and towels for everyone.
The kitchen was stocked with everything you need to cook and there were also some snacks provided as well.
Great location and close to downtown, Folly and West Ashley. A short walk to beautiful parks and also to see the mini horses Stormy & Winnie down the road as well.
You will love this cottage and Nan is one of the nicest hosts we have met!! 10 Stars!!

review_text:
Definitely agree with others that the cottage is even cuter in person. These are hosts that take a lot of care and pride in to making their Airbnb welcoming. From fresh flowers on the table to snacks and little cooking essentials like olive oil/salt/pepper they really thought about how to make the place feel warm. Very quiet neighborhood and a quick drive to downtown or the beach. We had to leave a day early because of Idalia and they even refunded us immediately without us even asking for it.
My tip for other guests is if you like firmer supportive pillows the ones there are perfect for you. If you like squishy down you’ll want to bring your own.
The owners are in this to be great hosts, not just make a big margin, and that is lovely to experience. You can confidently book.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The location was perfect, serene, and very homey and comfortable. Check-in was very easy, and the house had plenty of kitchen utensils/appliances/furnishings. There is a washing machine but no dryer (we assume because things are line dried), as well as an iron and ironing board. The only "complaints" we had were the bugs that managed to come out at night that closely resembled winged termites. They did fly into the sheets when we slept. Nan assured us they were not termites and they came out every spring. The beds are very comfortable and firm, but also loud if you move at all when you sleep. Other than keeping the bugs out, and noisy beds, the place was terrific. In the South Carolina heat and humidity the house stayed very cool and comfortable. We really enjoyed the porch furniture and scenery as well. The reviews that show Nan responds in about 2 hours is accurate. She also recommended a local park we could use for a family function that was *absolutely gorgeous*.

Inside the cottage is a comfortable bed, a clean bathroom, and a fully stocked kitchen. This will be our first choice if we ever get back to Charleston! It was a delight to meet Nan and Mark. They were never intrusive, but always responsive, sharing their insights of area attractions. We could not have been more pleased with this cottage!

review_text: This little cottage in the woods is just off a quiet street and not far from a park and tennis courts. The vibe is nearly magical and the place exudes a wonderful peacefulness and feeling of welcome I haven't seen beat elsewhere. The cottage, with two bedrooms, cute sitting and dining area, a front porch, small side porch and galley-style kitchen is cozy and wonderfully decorated--you can see attention to detail and culture throughout. Nan and Mark are lovely and popped by to introduce themselves and let us know there were bikes at our disposal and that, if we needed anything, they were just the next house over. The island is packed with history--the thing we missed out on was exploring because Nan's place was only a brief stop along our path. We'll know better for next time!

review_text: This house was one of the nicest homes that I have stayed in but unfortunately we left exhausted due to the noise that kept us awake until 4am and then again due to the loading dock at the College which started at 7 am. (Note: it was College of Charleston graduation weekend. Other times of the year could be quieter). The city has a noise ordinance but what's the use in calling when the door to a bar and a dance club is within earshot. We did love the home and I am sorry to be writing a not so favorable review because Lisa has really put some effort into this home. Lot's of nice touches such as fluffy towels and nice kitchenware. The courtyard is perfection and the parking for 4 cars is a huge added benefit! But, we knew we were in trouble when we saw a noise machine, earplugs and fans in the bedrooms. The owners know it's a problem and I just wish they had given us a discount on the fee. This was not a cheap home to rent and we had elderly grandparents with us.

Gorgeous Home/Perfect Location!
Home was perfect in every way. We were in town hosting our son’s wedding and stayed here for a week.
The 4 parking spots it offered came in handy and were very much appreciated.
Easy entry; safe area.
Enter to living room which is beautifully decorated, extremely comfortable, and very clean. Both dining room and kitchen were the same. Very roomy and well stocked with lovely furnishings. Outside courtyard was a bonus, it was both private and comfortable for our entire family to relax and enjoy together. All of the bedrooms were clean with extremely comfortable bedding and linens. And, the endless hot water was just wonderful!
Lisa thought of everything when stocking her home and the importance of making sure it was clean and comfortable for her guests is obvious.
This was an amazing rental. Better than we could have imagined. Oh, did I mention the location? Around the corner from Marion Square and walkable to everything downtown! Highly recommend.

review_text: Lisa’s place in Charleston was perfect for us. We were in town for my son’s wedding and needed space for our family. The place was clean, bright and comfortable. Each bedroom has its own bath, and the beds were comfortable with plenty of storage. There is private parking in the driveway, which was important for us as well. Lisa has thoughtful touches throughout the house, such as ear plugs and white noise machines to block the city noise, although frankly it was not terribly noisy. There were extra outlets, plenty of towels, coffee pods snacks and water just to name a few. We all would recommend Lisa’s place in Charleston highly. Thanks Lisa!!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
This property is perfect for your stay in Charleston! It is clean, full of southern charm, and the location simply cannot be beat if you want to walk to shops, amazing restaurants, and tourist destinations. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are well stocked (they supply good shampoo, conditioner, body wash) and the kitchen has all you need. There is a laundry room with steamer, iron and ironing board available. The courtyard is the perfect place to sip coffee, or a cocktail, and enjoy a little outdoor time.
The rules are simple – treat the property as your own, and they take care of the rest (no exhaustive lists of “to-do’s” when checking out that some Airbnb’s require). Highly recommend this beautiful, and hospitable Charleston home!

The house was conveniently located for sightseeing and had a nice outdoor patio. We highly recommend this location for anyone visiting Charleston!

The house was described accurately and was even more lovely than expected. Perfect location. I highly recommend this house! Extra bonus was the awesome parking. So convenient.
The water bottles and coffee were a welcome benefit.

review_text: We enjoyed our stay at 20 Burns very much. The location was excellent for being in the heart of Charleston. The 3 bedrooms were perfect for our family. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the beautiful springtime Charleston weather. Ear plugs and sound machines were provided just in case the noise of the city might be an issue. It wasn't for us and we didn't need the ear plugs. Lisa has created a welcoming, classic home away from home.

We very much enjoyed our stay in this lovely, historic home! Everything was very clean, & the home was well furnished. There were excellent toiletries, fluffy white towels, and the beds are very comfortable.
The location is fantastic! Half a block from King Street, we were able to walk to Market Street, the Battery, and a variety of great restaurants & excellent shopping.
As a few reviews had mentioned, it was a bit loud on the weekend nights, but the sound machine provided allowed us to sleep well!
We definitely recommend this home, and Lisa (whom we met upon arrival & who gave us some great local recommendations) as a hostess. Can’t wait to visit again!!

review_text: Lisa’s home is exactly as published but better. Space was fantastic. Everyone had their own space that were guests plus the groomsmen for my sons wedding had plenty of space to ready themselves. Location was top notch, right in the middle of it all! Parking was a huge plus. She had waters, coffee, shampoo, soap, hairdryers plus everything you need to have a meal in. The carriage house was a huge plus for my brothers family so we had the entire compound. I recommend anyone looking for a rental in Charleston to consider this one, you will not be sorry! We will be back the next time we are in town. Lisa was super responsive leading up to our reservation even allowing us to check in 30 min early:). We never reached out to her during our stay but feel sure she would have been equally responsive. Great host, great space and great town. Thank you so much for sharing your space with our family for our special occasion.

review_text: We had a wonderful 5-night stay at 20 Burns Lane! It was the perfect home for my family to stay while we were in Charleston for our son's wedding festivities. I was originally concerned about the parking, but we never had a problem. We actually walked to most places. The location was perfect! It was so nice to have other family members (who were out walking around town) to pop in and visit for a while. I was impressed that EVERY INCH of the home was used to the max. Every bedroom had a bathroom, plus an extra half bath by the laundry room. The bathroom sinks were tiny, but efficient... and an amazing use of space! The make-up mirrors, sound machines, coffee maker AND Keurig, fluffy pillows, comfy beds, plus two luggage racks in each bedroom ...were all such nice extras that helped to keep this Mother of the Groom calm, cool and collected. We hated to leave and hope to visit again. Thank you for sharing your beautiful home with us.

review_text: Greatest location available for a Charleston vacation! In the heart of Charleston just off King St. Walking distance to all the best restaurants and historic sites. We came to town for a Citadel homecoming weekend, walked and road bikes all over the city & had less than an 8 min Uber to campus. Right across the street from Marion Square, but tucked away where foot traffic is minimal. Lisa thought of every detail and then some. My wife and I stayed with two couples comfortably as we each had our own bath/shower. Each room has white noise machines and ear plugs plus fans and a fantastic air conditioning system! The courtyard was a house favorite for storing our bikes. The kitchen was perfect and had all we needed for several meals. The parking is tight for multiple full sized vehicles but we made it work with three full sized trucks and mid-size SUV. Lisa made check-in and check-out a breeze. Everything about this house and host was easy from beginning to end and in between! So grateful for Lisa and looking forward to our next visit. We’ll stay here for years to come!

rating_info:

,

review_text:
We booked Lisa’s house for a girls trip and the house was perfect for our needs. We did not have a car, so choosing a location that was in walking distance to most things was important to us. The house is about 1 block from King Street, where shopping and restaurants can be found, and easy to get Ubers for trips out to the plantations and other site seeing.
There are several reviews that speak to the noise, and we knew that it could be noisy when we booked. Staying during the week after the college term probably made a difference as we only experienced limited noise from the bar across the way into the evening hours. More noise came from the garbage collection than anything else for us. But there are sound machines and ear plugs in the bedrooms should you need them.
The house is very well appointed with pretty much everything we needed. Comfortable bedrooms with very nice linens, duel system air conditioning (lower level and upper level) ceiling fans, outdoor enclosed area for breakfast or other meals. Lisa supplied a variety of kureg coffees, tea and creamers which made it easy for coffee at home, which was very lovely especially on our first morning. It's an old house so the bathrooms are small, but were fine for us, with plenty of towels.
Lisa was very helpful answering questions pre booking and during our stay. If I were traveling again to Charleston, with another couple I would not hesitate to book again.

review_text: Booking Lisas property was the best decision we made for our Charleston trip. It is located on Kings rd and you can literally walk anywhere. The only Ubers we took was to and from the airport. There is also private parking in front of the property should you choose to rent a vehicle. The home itself was charming, clean, and there was so much attention to detail. From ear plugs, to water bottles, to coffee all available to you. This home has so much charm in every corner you turn. Each bedroom had their own bathroom and an additional one on the main level. There is no keys necessary for this home, she will let you decide a four digit code, you and your party can use that code to enter the home. This is nice because you don’t have to worry about losing keys or if someone needs to return to the house they wont need to worry about who has the key in their possession, you can simply go and come as you please. The location is extremely safe, we were all girls on the trip and did not feel worried at all. Do not think twice booking this property, just do it now before its too late for you to experience this beautiful Charleston Colonial Home.

Check-in and communications were effortless and Lisa was quick to answer our questions (although we only had a few because instructions and helpful information were readily available throughout the home). She even provided sleep aids if you are not accustomed to city noises. But as previously stated, you are in the heart of where it is all happening in Charleston. name: Lisa
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2021
,
·
Group trip
review_text:
If you need quiet to sleep, don't stay here, especially on a weekend (more on that later). The house is fantastically stocked, with plenty of plates and cutlery for 6, as well as cooking pots and some basic spices. The 3 bedrooms with en suite baths are great for 3 couples, and the courtyard makes an excellent addition for al fresco dining or visiting. Use of a washer and dryer was greatly appreciated by our group. Lots of towels were provided, and everything was sparkling clean.
As I mentioned at first, a major downside to the location (that the host can do nothing about) is the presence of a bar behind the house that plays loud music with a driving beat until 1-2am on weekends. Amazingly, it seemed that the sound /beat was amplified in the house, especially the bedrooms, in contrast to the living room in the house, or even the courtyard. You definitely need the earplugs and sound machine kindly provided by the host in each bedroom, to try and muffle the noise so you can sleep.
Overall, we really enjoyed our stay (only 1/2 block off of King!), but trying to get to sleep on Fri and Sat nights was a real issue. If not for the noise, this is definitely a 5 star stay! All restaurants we went to, were within 16-17 minutes walk, and we otherwise explored Charlestown completely on foot.

As disclosed, there is noise from nearby bars and clubs, but it was drowned out by the sound machine and ear plugs thoughtfully provided by our host. Overall a fantastic stay! We were all woken up a various times throughout our 4 day stay. Clubs right nearby with loud music. There is a noise ordinance in place at 11pm so the bars/music shut down at that point, but the other activity did not. They do provide noise machines and earplugs, which helped some.

This was quite a gem!!!
We had 3 couples staying for 4 nights, and this home met our every need with a fabulous location to boot! The kitchen is well-appointed and beautiful, with coffee, coffee-maker and Keureg with some starter cups available. The home is stylish and comfortable, and was spotless when we arrived. We were able to spread out to the 3 large bedrooms with their own attached full bathrooms and then were able to easily share the common area living room downstairs. The bedrooms and bathrooms have considerate special touches, such as hairdryers, shampoo & conditioner, soap, and extra towels. There are hand-sanitizer stations amply place throughout the house, and it is clean, clean, clean!
I would not hesitate to stay here again, and you can't beat its location (one block away from King St.). Our host was very responsive with our one question about recycling.
We will definitely be back!

review_text: I highly recommend this place. Lisa was a 5 star host. The house was super clean and even had little "sanitizing stations" though-out which was a touch not overlooked. The little details throughout the home made for a very comfortable stay: games, 1st aid kits, sound machines in the bedrooms, stocked coffee, barware, local magazines & reads, etc...anything you could need Lisa had though through! The lay out of the home lended itself well to our small group as the central living room and kitchen are centralized for gathering yet the sleeping areas are spread apart and each contain their own bathroom which was key! The location was perfect and central to being able to walk to restaurants & shops. We barley had to get into our cars once we arrived. I would 100% stay here again and am super pleased with my experience.

name: Minjee
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you are planning a relaxing vacation (or work-vacation) for a couple like us, book Sean and Rebecca's *treehouse* without hesitation! We were thinking about staying in Charleston but many places were going to be loud at night. I can sleep through anything but my husband really wanted a quiet place where he can sleep well yet still close enough to the historic Charleston and restaurants. The treehouse perfectly fit the bill! Very clean (we do not wear shoes inside, and felt totally comfortable barefoot), quiet, and well-appointed, in a nice neighborhood. We biked to Trader Joe's and whole foods for grocery runs (Walgreens is also next-door) and visited Metto coffee every morning (6 minute walk). A quick Uber ride to Charleston ($10-15 Uber in Apr 2022) across the bridge made it very easy to plan each day. We would go for a run in the morning, get ready for the day in the Charleston, and return in the evening after dinner. There are also nice restaurants in Mt. Pleasant - Highly recommend Nico if you love oysters (FYI half-price oysters on Mondays). I am an over-packer, but did not need to do so because there was every amenity available in the treehouse: shampoo/conditioner, laundry detergent/dryer sheets, even cooking oils/sprays. Unexpected nice features: Filtered water and ice dispenser in the fridge and Netflix installed in the TV with a guest account (even though I have a netflix account, it was a nice touch). Internet is reasonably fast.
We biked around with the bikes Sean and Rebecca provided (with helmets), and on our last day we tried to bike to the sullivan Island (supposedly 25 minute ride). Oh well, the chain popped out as we were almost at the Island, so after trying to fix it unsuccessfully we ended up taking the bikes back in an Uber XL (a very nice driver to let us do that). It will be a story to laugh about for years to come! Rebecca was so sweet about it even though we should have known better not to take on an adventure like that.
There are steps to the Treehouse (the unit is built above a stand-alone garage, a brilliant idea) so if you have mobility issues it is something to keep in mind. I can see myself bringing kids here (we have two under 4) with a travel stroller, although the bed is pretty high so if your kid is a wild sleeper then I recommend bringing an inflatable toddler bed and/or pack-and-play.
Our flight out of Charleston was not until 6pm so we asked for a late check-out, and Sean and Rebecca kindly offered a 2pm checkout. Our stay was nothing but comfortable and relaxing from the beginning to the end. Can't wait to come back here!

name: Olivia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
My husband, six month old baby, and I stayed here for a short two day trip while passing through on our way to Savannah. We have stayed in other listings in the Charleston area previously but Sean and Rebecca’s place was different in a great way. We enjoyed staying in the Mount Pleasant area for many reasons: 1. It is a quiet, safe neighborhood away from the often loud, chaotic downtown scene. 2. It is only a quick 5-10 minute drive into downtown Charleston which is accommodating. 3. We thoroughly enjoyed driving over the Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge every time we went into Charleston!
Some standout characteristics:
+ so clean.
+ accommodating with essentials such as towels, soaps/shower supplies, laundry needs, etc.
+ gorgeous marble countertops and bathroom shower was large, and lovely!
+ easy check-in/out and good communication with hosts.
+ the place is close to MANY stores. Literally a Trader Joe’s one minute down the road.
A few things to consider before booking:
+ pretty small space however it is furnished in such a way that allows for as much room as possible.
+ bed is not the most comfortable. I understand this is just my opinion and it is arbitrary but I still feel like I needed to mention that.
+ the shades do not allow for full darkness in the bedroom at night. There was also a motion sensor light turned on at the main property that just clicked on and off all night which got to be a little annoying.
Overall, this place is a wonderful option for a couple or small family. Our daughter does not have much of an opinion of things yet, but she seemed to enjoy rolling around on the carpet in the living room. :)

Lacy’s place is gorgeous! Perfect location, just down from our favorite place to eat while in Charleston, Amen Street! Stunning gas lights illuminate the romantic courtyard and you feel as though you are in an oasis unto yourselves, but are still just steps away from bustling Bay St.
We parked the car in the surface lot just one block away and did not drive it again until we left for Daniel Island. We easily spent the days we were there strolling the city and discovering other tasty places to eat seafood and beautiful boutiques to shop .
The loft is pristine, beautifully appointed and well stocked with all the things you need to make a stay free of issues. Comfortable bed, gorgeous bathrooms and the living room was a great place to relax on the couch each night after walking the day away.
Will definitely book this place again when in Charleston! Thank you for an exceptional stay!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I'm so glad my husband and I stayed here during our first trip to Charleston!! The place is beautiful and oh so spacious! Very appreciative with the attention to detail and amenities. Lacy & Jesse had a full coffee selection, iron + iron board, steamer, extra linens/towels, and pots and pans if you wanted to cook in the kitchen. The location was great and so close to some of the most famous Charleston areas such as Rainbow Row and The Battery. We were also within 15 min of walking distance to the most amazing restaurants. So lovely to be able to see Charleston and explore instead of driving through! The bed was so comfy and big. You can tell Lacy & Jesse takes pride in the space.
The only downfall is that the place does NOT come with a designated parking spot. Jesse suggested a few nearby garages that had a flat rate of $20/day so keep that in mind if you're looking to stay here. Despite that, I would definitely book my stay here again!

Couldn’t have been happier with Lacy’s place. My wife and I were down celebrating our 16th anniversary and we wanted to park upon arrival and just be able to walk everywhere. Lacy’s place was perfect for just that (parking garage is located a block towards the port). Located on East Bay near a ton of restaurants and galleries, the markets and a short walk to the battery etc. It couldn’t be more centrally located.
As for the house, it was perfect for the two of us. Kitchen was well equipped - though we never used it. Bed was comfortable. Wifi worked reliably. And the courtyard was always a welcome sight as we headed out for the day.
We would absolutely stay here again.
